factoid: The homestead consisted of a threshing floor.
The homestead consisted of outhouses.
The homestead consisted of stables.
The homestead consisted of a bathhouse.
The homestead consisted of a lodge.
The homestead consisted of a large brick house with a semicircular façade that was still under construction.
The garden around the large brick house was newly laid out.
The fences around the homestead were new and solid.
The gates around the homestead were new and solid.
Two fire pumps stood in a shed.
A water cart painted green stood in a shed.
The paths around the homestead were straight.
The bridges around the homestead were strong.
The bridges around the homestead had handrails.
The homestead bore an impression of tidiness and good management.
Pierre met some domestic serfs.
The domestic serfs answered inquiries about the prince's residence.
The domestic serfs pointed out a small newly built lodge close to the pond.
Antón was a man who had looked after Prince Andrew in his boyhood.
Antón helped Pierre out of his carriage.
Antón said that Prince Andrew was at home.
Antón showed Pierre into a clean little anteroom.
Pierre was struck by the modesty of the small house after the brilliant surroundings in which he had last met his friend in Petersburg.
The small house was clean.
The small house was modest.
The small house was surrounded by brilliant surroundings in which Pierre had last met his friend in Petersburg.
Pierre entered the small reception room.
The small reception room had still-unplastered wooden walls.
The wooden walls of the small reception room were redolent of pine.
Antón ran ahead on tiptoe and knocked at a door.
A sharp unpleasant voice asked "What is it?".
Antón answered that there was a visitor.
Antón told the visitor to wait.
A chair was pushed back.
Pierre went with rapid steps to the door.
Pierre came face to face with Prince Andrew.
Prince Andrew came out frowning.
Prince Andrew looked old.
Pierre embraced Prince Andrew.
Pierre lifted his spectacles while kissing Prince Andrew on the cheek.
Pierre looked at Prince Andrew closely.
Prince Andrew said "I did not expect you, I am very glad."
Pierre said nothing.
Pierre looked fixedly at Prince Andrew with surprise.
Pierre was struck by the change in Prince Andrew.
Prince Andrew's words were kindly.
Prince Andrew had a smile on his lips and face.
Prince Andrew's eyes were dull and lifeless.
Prince Andrew wanted to give a joyous sparkle but could not.
Prince Andrew had grown thinner.
Prince Andrew had become paler.
Prince Andrew had become more manly-looking.
Pierre was amazed by Prince Andrew's inertia.
Pierre was estranged by Prince Andrew's inertia.
Pierre was amazed by a wrinkle on Prince Andrew's brow.
The wrinkle indicated prolonged concentration on some thought.
People meeting after a prolonged separation usually have long conversations before settling on anything.
Pierre and Prince Andrew put questions and gave brief replies about things they knew ought to be talked over at length.
The conversation gradually settled on topics such as past life, plans for the future, Pierre's journeys and occupations, the war, and so on.
Pierre had noticed preoccupation and despondency in Prince Andrew's look.
The preoccupation and despondency were more clearly expressed in a smile with which Prince Andrew listened to Pierre.
Prince Andrew listened to Pierre with a smile when Pierre spoke with joyful animation about the past or the future.
Prince Andrew would have liked to sympathize with Pierre but could not.
Pierre began to feel that it was bad taste to speak of his enthusiasms, dreams, and hopes of happiness or goodness in Prince Andrew's presence.
Pierre was ashamed to express his new Masonic views.
Pierre's new Masonic views had been revived and strengthened by his late tour.
Pierre checked himself, fearing to seem naïve.
Pierre felt an irresistible desire to show his friend that he was now a quite different and better Pierre than he had been in Petersburg.
Pierre said "I can’t tell you how much I have lived through since then."
Pierre said "I hardly know myself again."
Prince Andrew said "Yes, we have altered much, very much, since then."
Prince Andrew asked "Well, and you? What are your plans?".
Prince Andrew repeated "Plans!" sarcastically.
Prince Andrew said "My plans?" as if astonished at the word.
Prince Andrew said "Well, you see, I’m building."
Prince Andrew said "I mean to settle here altogether next year."
Pierre looked silently and searchingly into Prince Andrew's face.
Prince Andrew's face had grown much older.
Pierre began to say "No, I meant to ask…".
Prince Andrew interrupted Pierre.
Prince Andrew said "But why talk of me?".
Prince Andrew said "Talk to me, yes, tell me about your travels and all you have been doing on your estates."
Pierre began describing what he had done on his estates.
Pierre tried to conceal his own part in the improvements on his estates.
Prince Andrew prompted Pierre's story several times.
Prince Andrew listened without interest.
Prince Andrew listened as if ashamed of what Pierre was telling him.
Pierre felt uncomfortable in Prince Andrew's company.
Pierre felt depressed in Prince Andrew's company.
Pierre became silent.
